intro: Cymopterus montanus var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple flowering spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy purple flowers that appear in late summer. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its unique floral structure and coloration make it a notable species in its native ecosystem.
